description: A ventricular shunt catheter is a medical device used to divert cerebrospinal fluid from the ventricles of the brain to another location.

attributes.name: Presence of Ventricular Shunt Catheter
attributes.description: Indicates whether a ventricular shunt catheter is present or absent.

values.name: Present
values.description: A ventricular shunt catheter is present.

values.name: Absent
values.description: A ventricular shunt catheter is absent.

attributes.name: Status
attributes.description: The status of the ventricular shunt catheter.

values.name: New placement
values.description: The ventricular shunt catheter has been newly placed.

values.name: Unchanged
values.description: The ventricular shunt catheter remains unchanged.

values.name: Complication
values.description: There is a complication with the ventricular shunt catheter.

values.name: Removed
values.description: The ventricular shunt catheter has been removed.

values.name: Ventriculoperitoneal (VP)
values.description: A ventriculoperitoneal shunt.

values.name: Ventriculoatrial (VA)
values.description: A ventriculoatrial shunt.

values.name: Ventriculopleural
values.description: A ventriculopleural shunt.

attributes.name: Appropriate location
attributes.description: Indicates whether the ventricular shunt catheter is in an appropriate location.

values.name: Yes
values.description: The ventricular shunt catheter is in an appropriate location.

values.name: No
values.description: The ventricular shunt catheter is not in an appropriate location.

attributes.name: Proximal tip location
attributes.description: The location of the proximal tip of the ventricular shunt catheter.

values.name: Right lateral ventricle
values.description: The proximal tip of the ventricular shunt catheter is in the right lateral ventricle.

values.name: Left lateral ventricle
values.description: The proximal tip of the ventricular shunt catheter is in the left lateral ventricle.

values.name: Third ventricle
values.description: The proximal tip of the ventricular shunt catheter is in the third ventricle.

values.name: Not identified
values.description: The location of the proximal tip of the ventricular shunt catheter is not identified.

attributes.name: Distal tip location
attributes.description: The location of the distal tip of the ventricular shunt catheter.

values.name: Peritoneal cavity
values.description: The distal tip of the ventricular shunt catheter is in the peritoneal cavity.

values.name: Right atrium
values.description: The distal tip of the ventricular shunt catheter is in the right atrium.

values.name: Pleural cavity
values.description: The distal tip of the ventricular shunt catheter is in the pleural cavity.

attributes.name: Valve Type
attributes.description: The type of valve used in the ventricular shunt catheter.

values.name: Programmable
values.description: A programmable valve is used.

values.name: Fixed pressure
values.description: A fixed pressure valve is used.

attributes.name: Valve Setting (if programmable)
attributes.description: The setting of the programmable valve used in the ventricular shunt catheter.

values.name: Specify setting
values.description: Specify the setting of the programmable valve.

values.name: Not applicable
values.description: A programmable valve is not applicable.

attributes.name: Complications
attributes.description: Any complications associated with the ventricular shunt catheter.

values.name: None
values.description: No complications with the ventricular shunt catheter.

values.name: Catheter fracture
values.description: A catheter fracture is present.

values.name: Tip migration
values.description: Tip migration of the ventricular shunt catheter.
